Module com.mihaibojin.props.core
Package com.mihaibojin.props.core

Class RefactoredProp<T1,​T2>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mihaibojin.props.core.RefactoredProp<T1,​T2>
  • Type Parameters:
    T1 - the type of the first property
    T2 - the type of the second property
    public class RefactoredProp<T1,​T2>
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class which attempts to resolve two properties, converting the second property's value to the first property's type.

    If any of the two Props are required the call to value() will result in a ValidationException when neither of the two properties can resolve a value.

      Class constructor which specifies a resolverId from which Props should be resolved.

        Shorthand constructor with a null resolverId.

      • RefactoredProp

        public RefactoredProp​(Props registry,
                      @Nullable
                      java.lang.String resolverId,
                      Prop<T1> prop1,
                      Prop<T2> prop2,
                      java.util.function.Function<T2,​T1> converter)
        Class constructor which specifies a resolverId from which Props should be resolved.

        This constructor accepts unbound Props. Passing already bound Prop objects will result in a BindException.

        Throws:
        BindException - if any of the two Props are already bound to the specified Props registry

    • Method Detail

      • value

        public java.util.Optional<T1> value()
        This method attempts the following actions.
      • If the first property has a value it is returned
      • next, it tries to load the second property's value
      • finally, the class returns an empty Optional of type T1 or it throws an exception
Throws:
ValidationException - if a value could not be loaded from either of the two Props and validation failed at least once
